title: Multiple Absence Periods with Six-Year Rule

scenario_info.name: Multiple Absence Periods (ATO Example 80)
scenario_info.description: Ian owns a Sydney home and is posted to different cities for work over 30 years. He rents out Sydney during absences, buys/sells other properties, but never claims MRE on them. The combined rental periods exceed 6 years.
applicable_rules: ITAA97 s118.145: Six-year absence rule (partial - combined rental exceeds 6 years)
Multiple absence periods are combined for the 6-year test
Can choose to treat Sydney as MR since no other property claimed as MR

property_history.description: Second rental period begins (posted to Melbourne)
Returns to Sydney, re-establishes as main residence

properties.notes: Complex scenario with multiple rental periods totaling 7 years. First 6 years exempt under s118.145, remaining 1 year (365 days) is taxable.

property_history.description: Moved in but did NOT claim as main residence

properties.notes: Brisbane property - MRE not claimed to preserve Sydney six-year rule

property_history.description: Moved in but did NOT claim as main residence

properties.notes: Melbourne property - MRE not claimed to preserve Sydney six-year rule

user_query: I owned my Sydney home for 30 years but rented it out during two work relocations totaling 7 years. I also bought and sold properties in Brisbane and Melbourne but never claimed MRE on them. What is my CGT position?
